data.title: Fix potentially removing actors twice from world in Actor::ChangeOwner
data.body: Fixes #8262

data.title: Ingame map editor tooltips are inconsistent
data.body:
- Hovering over an actor in the actor palette shows the actor's internal name in a tooltip (e.g. atek) but not the friendly name (e.g. Allied Tech Center)
- Hovering over an actor in the world shows the actor's friendly name in a tooltip (e.g. Allied Tech Center) but not the internal name (e.g. atek).

I expected the editor to show both internal and friendly names in both the actor palette and the world.

data.title: Fedora packages or COPR repo
data.body:
Fedora has strange issues to provide an usable Mono environment, at least for Mono versions 3 and 4.
Request is to provide all OpenRA packages incl. unbundling at COPR via a clean repository. SUSE OpenBuild Service (OBS) can not deal with partly COPR based packages. So let's move the whole stuff, at least for Fedora concerns, to COPR.

See also:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7140
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6863
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/17807847-fedora-packages-or-copr-repo?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun cyborg logic
data.body: See http://modenc.renegadeprojects.com/Cyborg for reference.

data.title: ISpeedModifier does not work anymore
data.body: Both `TakeCover` and `ScaredyCat` are affected. Tested on RA and TS.

data.title: Made the main menu news button optional
data.body: Coverity detected it as a likely NRE. However thirdparty mods may want to disable our news button.

data.title: Fixed Alpha Blend for Path Search Debug Overlay
data.body:
Fixed Path Cost Overlay Rendering.

Extends #8249

data.title: Removed an unnecessary (too late) null check at EditorResourceBrush.AllowResourceAt
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8253. Note: this was bogus before. Another Coverity rule catched it.

data.title: Fixed a dereference of an explicit null value in VoxelRenderer
data.body: Coverity detected that code paths can lead there where this is explicitly set to null. Not sure how likely it is. The code a few lines above already has this null check.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException when not using the optional MAP LabelWidget
data.body: Obviously a copy & paste error. Only a problem if you use a custom chrome though.

data.title: Fixed a null reference exception in ColorPickerLogic when deciding not to use an ActorPreviewWidget
data.body: It is indeed on optional as detected properly by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a potential null reference exception during in-game editor resource placement
data.body: Discovered by Coverity. I assume wrongly set up tileset definitions could lead to a crash here, if it wouldn't blow before so probably not too severe.

data.title: Fixed missing dispose on stream in LegacyMapImporter
data.body: Similiar to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8251.

data.title: Fixed a resource leak in IniFile
data.body: as detected by Coverity Scan. I guess it is minor, because we only use it in the command line utility which are quit after execution.

data.title: added mission 6c nod
data.body:
So here is the last of the level 6 mission.

It is similar to the other 2 mission.

I added a scondary objectiv. But this is very difficult, don't know if it is okay...

data.title: Fix Alpha Blend for Path Search Debug Overlay
data.body:
Pull #8176 introduced errors in debug overlay rendering of costs for path search.

Fixed by changing color of overlays.

data.title: Fixed transparency breakage on quad and line rendering
data.body: A regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8176.

data.title: Added a UNIX man page
data.body: `rpmlint` kept complaining and we got so many command line options scattered through different places so I decided to write one. First time I did this. It wasn't that hard. My main focus was server admins here. You can preview this locally using `man ./packaging/linux/openra.6`. Also did a test run at https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/games:openra/development

data.title: Remove some unused using statements
Added Coverity static code analysis
data.body: See https://scan.coverity.com/travis_ci

data.title: TD Balances
data.body:
Changes:

Light tanks were changed as followed to prevent them from being en massed and overpowering medium tanks.

Artillery changed due to frustration of explosions. Chance to explode also counted towards chance to chain explode. Resulting in 75% chance to lose 3-5 artilleries at once. Explosion also killed infantry.

Chemspray fire rate changed to help defend vs fast moving vehicles that crush. This includes stealth tanks and APCs.

Hummers/buggies damage vs heavy reduced to prevent them from countering light tanks and APCs when they shouldn't. They still make great harvester herassments.

Grenadier projectile speed increase to help vs en mass flame infantry and chem troopers. Making them a useful counter once more.

data.title: Fixed captured buildings producing bot controled units
data.body: Should fix #8241 (at least the second part).

data.title: Bot related Disguise desync on release 20150424
data.body:
It happened as I tried to disguise as a rilfe man (owned by a bot) that shot at me.
Unfortunately the replay doesn't show anything (it stops a few seconds before the critical situation).
Here are the syncreports and the difference between them: [Gist](https://gist.github.com/abcdefg30/f3b58b10fdc141132a4a)
Exception (probably not too helpful though):

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150424
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 20987: Blame Tick.
 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync(Int32 frame, String blame)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.<>c__DisplayClass9.<TickImmediate>b__5(Int32 clientId, Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.<>c__DisplayClass3.<Receive>b__2(Int32 client, Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<>c__DisplayClass5.<CheckSyncUnchanged>b__4()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Bot still control units/buildings that have been captured
data.body:
In RA in mission "survive 01" the bot continue to control vehicles that are hijacked.
In TD in mission "Invasion of Egypt (a)" the bot continue to control buildings i have captured.

data.title: Fix nuke flashes
data.body: Fixes #8238 and adds nuke flashes to d2k (which is finally possible now that we use premultiplied alpha).

data.title: Fixed the build of playtest-20150524 on Mono 2.10
data.body: https://build.opensuse.org/package/live_build_log/games:openra/playtest/Fedora_21/i586 as usual.
